Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no allocation of 200 million visas for Chinese people in Australia.
Understate: The claim understates the actual visa policy for Chinese citizens, which generally allows only three-month stays but also offers a Frequent Traveller stream with 10-year visas.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or official statement to back up the claim of 200 million visas being allocated.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there is a deliberate "invasion" of Chinese tourists based on the false allocation of visas, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the claim may be based on misinformation or a misunderstanding of the visa policy for Chinese citizens.
